comments.commentBody: What an enormously generous, and touching love story.....I am sorry that it has to be ending too soon.....he was lucky as clearly were you.
Harvard Loeb Fellowship should overnight Amy an award letter.
I have the same problem except I worry who will adopt my goldfish after I'm gone..

Well, there is nothing surprising about Sessions lying. After all, Trump appointed many dregs of the political world to powerful positions.
(sigh)

His Website has mysteriously gone dark, right after last nights Rachel Maddow report and his appearance on her show. I thought it was because so many people were checking it out last night, but this morning also I could not access the site.

If anybody has any information I would love to hear it. I agree that Mr. Johnson is performing a valuable Public service and I would hate to think that some foreign entity is responsible for shutting down his site.

I knew her name looked really familiar. I have been reading her books to my son for a couple years now. I don't think he understands the humor in them but one day he will. Keep fighting Amy but know your words live on.
There's nothing I can say to you, except this: If we all had the love and grace you two have shared the world would be a better place. Blessings to you and your whole familty.

C).

It is not enough to establish that these Trump minions just lied about their interactions with Russians, and one of them under oath no less, but we need to know why, and what is it about the Russians that Trump and his coterie need to talk to them so much. Of course, rotting starts at the head:
Liar, Liar, (orange)
Hair's on fire!
What compels DT to lie about his Russian connection ?? And one night of subdued reading of teleprompter doesn't a POTUS make. We need to smoke the truth out of the White House.

You and your republican pals predictably abhor bushwacking only of republican government officials. Can you say Bengazi? 14 times? The interference of Russia in the US elections is a threat to all, and every lead on this treachery must be vigorously run down. If the shoe had been on Hilary's foot there would already be an impeachment. Now its just business as usual for a member of the Armed Services Committee to meet with a Russian operative. Every Russian diplomat doubles as a spy; at least that's what every republican would have told you three months ago.

Republican hypocrisy and victimhood has almost become comic relief these days. A month ago, PA Senator Toomey said he was so depressed that the Dems might not sign off on everything Trump wanted, and lamented that his party had never been so recalcitrant. This one month into an foundering administration after a year of never having a hearing on Obama's SCOTUS nominee. The outright lies and hubris of republicans is just staggering.

I am curious.  What is the Russian Ambassador doing at the GOP convention?  Does that seem strange to anyone but me?  Yes, Sessions was caught in a lie, intentional or not (but, after all, he is a lawyer - he knows when and how to be careful), and then he did the thing people do when they have something they would rather people not know about, he said no, and then tried to cover it up. Hope sprang eternal for awhile.  But here's the thing.  If you watch Al Franken's questioning of Mr. Sessions, prior to the point where he said "no", he made many denials having any knowledge of anything having to do with meetings with the Russians by him or anyone of the campaign.  He just did not know, so consequently, he could not answer.  It wasn't that he did recall, could not remember, was not sure, may have said "hello - how are ya" - no.  He said he had no knowledge.  He was lying that whole time, not just once, but multiple times to Al Franken's questions.  Before Congress, under oath, like a deposition.  I wish his "friends" would be confronted with the totality of the "lack of knowledge" that he expressed.  How could he have no knowledge?  C'mon.  He knew.  He was one of the first ardent supporters of Trump.  He has got to go.
We sure don't hear much from the right-wing about moral relativism any more.
I never had sex with that girl. I never told anyone to lie. Never. Not once.
The GOP is the party of hypocrisy. They sold their souls to Russia and it's our problem.

In French politics they talk about "Caviar Socialists," meaning those who claim publicly to espouse socialist egalitarian values while living the high life. Judging from the Russophilia displayed by Team Trump,  "Caviar Republicans" would have two meanings.

This whole brouhaha is not just about lying and perjury. What is worse is that nothing is done until they are caught. Not one iota of contrition and not an ethical bone in their bodies.

Patterns of behaviour don't suddenly change. This will be the modus operandi of this administration until Donald is impeached or the next election.

And while we are in the kitchen trying to clean up the broken plates, our orange 5 year old is ripping pages out of the family Bible, sticking a peanut butter and jelly sandwich into the VCR, shoving the family dog into the washing machine, and setting fire to the garage.

I vote "C".

However, my preference would be to dress him in Pee Wee Herman attire and put him on a bus to Selma

Oh my, he's so charming . . . too bad he's a Machiavellian race purist, misogynist, and amoral.

I'm sure Roland Freisler (Nazi jurist), Andrey Vyshinsky (Stalin's prosecutor), Son Sen (Khmer Rouge killing fields architect), and Talaat Pasha (Armenian genocide instigator) were all equally charming.

Derail this train of proto-evil leaders while we can using whatever legal means necessary and available.

As I read this comment, all I can think of is Mr. Sessions's zeal in wanting to impeach Bill Clinton for perjury. Sorry but this "roll over and play bipartisan" after the GOP wouldn't even let Obama appoint a Supreme Court nominee a full year before his term ended is just absolutely ridiculous. The GOP opened Pandora's Box, don't cry about what's coming out. You people shout "death panels!" in one breath and bemoan "bushwhacking [...] that further erodes our ability to work together effectively" in the next. You're almost as ridiculous as Orrin Hatch whining about "Democratic obstructionism" in the Senate.

And "legitimate elections", you say? That's a joke. Most of us didn't even have elections. Fewer than 1 in 10 House districts are truly competitive since legislators get to choose their voters, and a majority of voters live in "safe states" -- why, don't you remember? Just a few short weeks ago your lot was dismissing millions of said voters in California.

A system which lays claim to the popular will but which does not express it is de facto illegitimate. I yield back to John Locke:

"[T]he government is not legitimate unless it is carried on with the consent of the governed."

If lying were the criterion for the removal of a serving Federal official--and I would think that to be a good initial criterion to use--this entire Republican administration and many if not most of Congress would be dusting off their resumes.  Although Trump is not a lawyer, the old saw about lawyers applies: How do you know a lawyer is lying?  He opens his mouth...

I hope that the NY Times will not allow itself to be corrupted by ANY contact with the Russians - and will consider closing down its Moscow bureau, as well as not allowing its Washington correspondents to ever meet with the Russian Ambassador to the United States.

Consideration should also be given to focusing on what the Russian hacking revealed - the corruption within the Democratic Party. The US public should be protected from this type of information.

Of course, any contact with a Russian is the same.

Me talking to my Russian buddy at the gym and top campaign officials speaking with Russian officials during a hacking scandal are the same thing.

Russian/Trump apologists have to do better than this. It sounds foolish.

How amazing!! just by chance it was the democratic party that was hacked and its corruption revealed. I am certain that the Republican party had no such corruption. Also at the same time, just by chance, Trump party people meet with the Russians several times, and for some reason need to lie about it. Why would they need to hide that??
As to the difference between a journalist meeting with the Russians and the staff of a presidential campaign, I can't figure that one out.

Corruption? Hardly. Stacking odds for one candidate is just poor politics, a lack of foresight, all smothered in hubris. To be corrupt there would need to be some rules broken, and the DNC, like the RNC, is not operating as a entity under criminal laws.

Amazingly, the facts of the hacks, are nothing that special, nor very shocking had you been looking at how the DNC leadership was infatuated with HRC,and the prospect of the first female president. And a known-entity to many in the party, more importantly outside in the land of donors, and such.
Weakest. President. Ever.

Dumbest. Presidential Apprentice. Ever.
There, fixed it for you.

"I keep my promises." Now who said that?

Tax returns?

Term limits?

A better question would be, "When is a promise, not a promise?"

Haven't heard about the two military aides before but if true why hasn't Sessions trotted them out to back up his "Only talking Senator stuff" story? And "infamous" is one way of characterizing the dossier - another would be "revealing."

Christine, El Presidente Trompo could meet with the Russians as Grover Cleveland, and as for 'Pixie' Jeff Sessions, he may have a goblin inside him.  Joking aside, the bubble of this Administration is not leaking but flooding.
